# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 309, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 380, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 662, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph of \(y = \left|3x - 2a\right|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 495, 96]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(z_{1} = r_{1}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{1}}\) and \(z_{2} = r_{2}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 374, 127]]<|/det|>
Show that \((z_{1}z_{2})^{*} = z_{1}^{*}z_{2}^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 510, 727, 530]]<|/det|>
\(z = 3\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) is a root of the equation \(z^{2} + bz + c = 0\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 598, 560]]<|/det|>
State the other root and hence find the values of \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 540, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z + 4}{z + 4\mathrm{i}}\) is real and \(|z| = \sqrt{10}\). Give your answers in the form \(z = x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 918, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 584, 104]]<|/det|>
Let \(\mathrm {f}(x)=\frac {3a-5x}{(3a+2x)(2a-x)}\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 410, 138]]<|/det|>
Express \(\mathrm {f}(x)\) in partial fractions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 917, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 153, 917, 170]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 695, 94]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\cot^2 x - \tan^2 x = 5 \sec 2x\) for \(0^\circ < x < 90^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 515, 139, 533]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 452, 534]]<|/det|>
The point \(D\) is the reflection of \(A\) in \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 546, 390, 565]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 546, 920, 565]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 71, 532, 89]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 94, 601, 125]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 4y\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = x\sin 2y\sin 3x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 131, 420, 152]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = \frac{1}{12}\pi\) when \(x = \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 144, 181]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 688, 182]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\) and \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 917, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 515, 144, 534]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 601, 536]]<|/det|>
Given that \(0 < y < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), find the values of \(y\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 516, 918, 535]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 655, 89]]<|/det|>
Show that if a sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 98, 601, 125]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2}\Bigl (\pi -\tan^{-1}\bigl (4x_n\bigr)\Bigr)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 131, 918, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 420, 151]]<|/det|>
converges, then it converges to \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 186, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 920, 536]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula in part **(c)** to calculate \(a\) correct to 4 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 516, 920, 535]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
